tests.sic.sST.nbin

Class sSTCnbin

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.sST.nbin.sSTCnbin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    sSTCnbinTermPlotter

    public class sSTCnbin
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Negative Binomial process with parameters λ and pl (both positive). The system faces linear holding and backorder costs with cost rates h>0 and p>0. It also faces fixed costs: fixed review cost per period Kr≥0, and fixed order cost Ko≥0. Finally, there is a constant lead-time for each order being placed equal to L≥0. The control parameters then, are s (the reorder point), S (the order-up-to point), and T (the review interval). When fully optimized in all its control parameters, this is the globally optimal control policy and the resulting cost is the best possible cost of such an echelon (result known since the 50's by Arrow et al.)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2021

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double bP(int rpj, double T, double lambda, double pl, double L)
      computes the average long-run expected unit years of shortage incurred from t+L to t+L+T of a single-echelon system facing demands that follow the Negative Binomial (ie compound Poisson) distribution with arrival rate lambda and process parameter of the Logarithmic distribution p, with an (s,S,T) periodic-review policy, taking into account fixed costs (review and ordering costs).
      double eval(java.lang.Object x, java.util.HashMap param)
      evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Negative Binomial demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (s,S,T) periodic review policy.
      (package private) Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x, java.util.HashMap param)
      evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (s,S,T) periodic review policy.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
                   java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Negative Binomial demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (s,S,T) periodic review policy.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - double[] representing s, S and T or DblArray1Vector
        param - HashMap if not null, it may contain value for the Kr parameter
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if the computations go awry, see method evalBoth(x).

      • evalBoth

        Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x,
              java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (s,S,T) periodic review policy. It returns in a pair of doubles, both the actual value as well as the value when the order cost Ko is zero, forming a lower bound on the cost function.
        Parameters:
        x - double[] or popt4jlib.DblArray1Vector representing s, S and T
        param - HashMap // may contain a <"Kr",$val> pair
        Returns:
        utils.Pair // Pair<Double result, Double lowerbound>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if Po is computed outside [0,1] or if any number computed turns out to be Double.NaN.

      • sum1

        protected double sum1(int r,
                      int R,
                      double T,
                      double t,
                      double l,
                      double m,
                      double IC,
                      double phat,
                      double eps)
        not part of the public API. Used to be private, but is over-ridden by class sSTCnbinTermPlotter to plot the partial sums.
        Parameters:
        r - int the re-order point
        R - int the order-up-to point
        T - double the review period length
        t - double the lead-time
        l - double the mean demand-rate of the Negative Binomial distribution
        m - double the mean lead-time demand
        IC - double the holding cost rate
        phat - double the back-orders cost rate
        eps - double the threshold below which when the ratio of the last _numTerms terms sum up to divided by the total number of terms added up so far falls, the computation of the infinite series stops
        Returns:
        double

      • sum2

        protected double sum2(int r,
                      int R,
                      double T,
                      double l,
                      double eps)
        not part of the public API. Used to be private, but it needs to be over-ridden by class sSTCnbinTermPlotter.
        Parameters:
        r - int the reorder point
        R - int the order-up-to point
        T - double the review period length
        l - double the demand rate
        eps - the same threshold as specified in sum1(), but for this method.
        Returns:
        double

      • updateMaxAddedTermsInSum12

        protected static void updateMaxAddedTermsInSum12(int n)
        update the maximum number of terms needed to add up in order to compute either of the functions sum1() or sum2(). Not part of the public API. Used to be private, but is needed in the sSTCnbinTermPlotter class.
        Parameters:
        n - int

      • getMaxAddedTermsInSum12

        public static int getMaxAddedTermsInSum12()
        used in diagnostics, to get the maximum number of terms added in order to compute the value of sum1() or sum2() sums.
        Returns:
        int

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.sic.sST.poisson.sSTCnbin <s> <S> <T> <Kr> <Ko> <L> <λ> <pl> <h> <p>. The constraints on the variables and parameters values are as follows:
        • s,S integer, S≥s
        • T>0
        • λ,pl>0
        • h>0
        • p>0
        All other parameters must be non-negative.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]

      • H

                          double T,
                          double t,
                          double l,

                          double IC,
                          double phat)
        method is NOT part of the public API. Used to be private, but is needed in the sSTCnbinTermPlotter class.
        Parameters:
        rpj - int r+j
        T - double the review period
        t - double the lead-time
        l - double demand rate
        pl - double the parameter of the logarithmic distribution part of the Negative Binomial
        m - double lead-time demand rate
        IC - double holding cost rate
        phat - double back-orders cost rate
        Returns:

      • bP

        public static double bP(int rpj,
                        double T,
                        double lambda,
                        double pl,
                        double L)
        computes the average long-run expected unit years of shortage incurred from t+L to t+L+T of a single-echelon system facing demands that follow the Negative Binomial (ie compound Poisson) distribution with arrival rate lambda and process parameter of the Logarithmic distribution p, with an (s,S,T) periodic-review policy, taking into account fixed costs (review and ordering costs).
        Parameters:
        rpj - int the IP immediately after a review
        T - double review period length
        lambda - double arrival rate
        pl - double second parameter of Nbin distribution
        L - double lead-time
        Returns:
        double back-orders part of the total cost

      • n_nbinnfoldconv_nbincdfcompl

        protected static double n_nbinnfoldconv_nbincdfcompl(int Rrj,
                                                     double lT,
                                                     double pl,
                                                     int n,
                                                     int j)
        last-attempt log-exp trick to compute the terms in the sum1 method. Not part of the public API. Used to be private, but is needed in the sSTCnbinTermPlotter class.
        Parameters:
        Rrj - int the value R-r-j
        lT - double the value l*T
        pl - double the value pl
        n - int the number of folds
        j - int the index
        Returns:
        double
